page.title: 01Painswick Valley
page.content: This rural area is part of the beautiful Cotswold Country-Side.The Painswick Valley,where the stream once turned the water-wheels of many woollen mills,runs through the middle. The hills rise to high vantage points, such as Bulls Cross and Scottsquar hill,where there are panoramic views. Common land and Woodland here are famous for wild flowers and butterflies and the popular Cotswold Way goes through. In this block are the villages of Painswick,Slad,Edge and Pitchcombe and part of the development at Whiteshill. These are divided from each other by hills and Woodland and linked by winding country roads.Slad is the home of the famous poet and author Laurie Lee.The main road between Stroud and Cheltenham runs through Painswick and on to the North Cotswolds.
